ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My Ottoman Turkish skills improved greatly.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Teacher was very knowledgeable. Some of the other students were a bit rude to her at times, so it was quite sad for the teacher. But we still love her!

I liked that we were exposed to all kinds of different documents through people bringing in their own texts to read. On the other hand, I felt the course was quite disorganized and it was not clear what we were meant to get out of it - vocabulary? practice at deciphering certain kinds of scripts? Obviously this was difficult partly because of the different levels of the students in the class but I felt it could have been set out better. Also, I did not find the quizzes particularly useful - as I don't actually think that vocabulary is a particularly good use of Ottoman class time as it is so specific to genre and time period.
It is a challenge to teach students at such different levels, but I think considering that, the course was organized in a sensible way that allowed all students to benefit.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Ottoman Turkish is a beautiful language!

If you are a student of Ottoman history, no question you should take this class. Whatever its drawbacks or hitches, it is unquestionably both useful and necessary for anyone who needs to use Ottoman in their work.
Yes, the instructor is extremely invested and if you invest time and effort, you can certainly benefit from this course.
